Chapter 1

[Hunter Buchanan]29-hunter did n’t believe in love at first sight . Hell , [he]29-hunter did n’t much believe in love at all .

But the moment [he]29-hunter ’d seen the tall redhead standing in [the foyer of one of [[his]29-hunter empty houses]194-his empty houses]193-the foyer of one of his empty houses , a box of books in [her]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before arms and a skeptical look on [her]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before face , [he]29-hunter ’d felt . . . something . [She]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before ’d been bold and fearless with [her]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before words , something that attracted [him]29-hunter as [a man who clung to the shadows]195-a man who clung to the shadows .

And when [she]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before ’d admitted to [[her]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before quiet friend]196-her quiet friend that [most men bored [her]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before]197-most men bored her and [she]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before wanted something different in a relationship than just a pretty face ?

[Hunter]29-hunter knew [she]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before was meant for [him]29-hunter .

[She]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before was pretty , young , and single . [She]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before had a smart mind and a sharp tongue . [He]29-hunter liked that about [her]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before . [She]192-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before was unafraid and laughed easily . Chapter 2

[Gretchen Petty]503-gretchen picked the lemon off [her]282-a beautiful woman water glass . “ Do [you]503-gretchen suppose if [I]503-gretchen take enough of [these home]1348-these home , it ’ll make [me]503-gretchen a decent dinner ? ”[503-gretchen]

“ [Gretchen]503-gretchen , ”[53-kat] [Kat]53-kat said , exasperated . “ Are [you]503-gretchen serious ? This is the fourth project [you]503-gretchen ’ve been late on this year . ”[53-kat]

“ For [Astronaut Bill]42-astronaut bill and the Space Vixens of [Dark Planet]7-dark planet ? Are [you]503-gretchen kidding [me]503-gretchen ? It ’s pulp , [Gretchen]503-gretchen ! Granted , it ’s pulp with a huge following , but it ’s still freaking pulp . Just write . ”[503-gretchen]

Chapter 4

[Gretchen]503-gretchen nervously deleted and undeleted the last paragraph of chapter thirteen , chewing on [her]503-gretchen lip . * * *

One Week Later

[Gretchen]503-gretchen stared at the thirtieth letter and contemplated burning the entire trunk of [them]574-them . “ Seriously , [Igor]1396-igor , [I]503-gretchen do n’t see how a project like this could be so mind - numbingly dull . ”[503-gretchen]

The cat did n’t get up from [his]572-he spot under the lamp , basking in the glow of the artificial light . [He]572-he did n’t even stir .

[She]503-gretchen sighed , carefully placing the letter back in the trunk and stripping off [her]503-gretchen plastic gloves . At least it was close to dinnertime . Strange how the project [she]503-gretchen ’d been so excited about had turned out to be a total snooze - fest , and the billionaire [she]503-gretchen ’d initially thought to avoid turned out to be the highlight of [her]503-gretchen day .

Over the past week , [Gretchen]503-gretchen had woken up early , dressed ( well , sometimes ) , and headed to [the library]475-the library to dutifully work on [the project]408-the project . Each letter was opened up , attached to a specialized clipboard with delicate care , and then transcribed . There were better ways to do such things , as [she]503-gretchen ’d pointed out to [Eldon]61-eldon at least once , but [he]572-he seemed very against [her]503-gretchen ideas . When [she]503-gretchen was finished with cataloging the letters , [she]503-gretchen ’d be able to move on to the next phase of the project , which involved turning all [her]503-gretchen notes into some cohesive sort of storyline that would make a novel .

Of course , that was going to be a bit trickier than [she]503-gretchen ’d anticipated . The letters were boring as hell . Written in a tight , crabby script , [Ms. Lulabelle Vargas]82-lulabelle droned on and on to a [Mister Benedict Benthwick]83-ben about the weather in [Rochester]13-rochester . Or how [the family]1458-the family vacationed for the summer in [Jersey]14-jersey . Sometimes [she]503-gretchen commented on flowers in [[[her]503-gretchen father]578-her father ’s gardens]579-her father ’s gardens or the upcoming Christmas Eve ball that seemed eons away . Sometimes [she]503-gretchen commented on [[her]503-gretchen fashionable new neighbor]580-the neighbor , down to the number of bows [the woman]503-gretchen wore in [her]503-gretchen bonnet ( thirty - nine ) .

Finishing seemed eons away for [Gretchen]503-gretchen , too . [She]503-gretchen ’d gone through plenty of the letters and [they]581-they ’d only gotten to September of 1872 . [She]503-gretchen still had most of the trunk to go through . By the time [she]503-gretchen got through all the letters , [she]503-gretchen ’d know the weather patterns for the entire time period , [[the neighbor]580-the neighbor ’s wardrobe]582-the neighbor ’s wardrobe , and [she]503-gretchen ’d probably want to jump off the balcony from the sheer monotony of it all .

And because the letters were so incredibly dull it was taking [her]503-gretchen a damn long time to work through [them]581-they . [She]503-gretchen had a month to catalog the hundreds of letters . [She]503-gretchen ’d gone through thirty in the last week . At this rate , [she]503-gretchen ’d be done by , well . . . [she]503-gretchen thought of upcoming holidays and cringed .

[[Her]503-gretchen agent]288-her agent would kill [her]503-gretchen if [she]503-gretchen blew an important deadline like this one . Not only was [she]503-gretchen behind on [her]503-gretchen Astronaut Bill deadline , but now this one ? It was n’t looking good .

[The cat]29-hunter ignored [her]503-gretchen .

[Gretchen]503-gretchen set [her]503-gretchen alarm for sunrise . [She]503-gretchen had a plan , and today [she]503-gretchen was going to put it into action .

[She]503-gretchen sat down at the letters and began to work , glancing at the door repeatedly . Excitement was making [her]503-gretchen twitchy , and it was hard to settle down into the latest letter . [They]623-they were so incredibly dry . [Lula]85-lula wrote to someone named [Ben]83-ben over and over again , and [Ben]83-ben never wrote back . It was so boring to read , like a one - sided conversation . [My]0-i dearest [Benedict]83-ben ,

So much has changed since [we]626-we last wrote .

Yeah , [Gretchen]503-gretchen thought to [herself]503-gretchen . Like winter into spring . Not exciting .

[I]0-i can not believe [we]626-we are to be parted once more . The three months [we]626-we spent together were [Heaven]86-heaven on [earth]627-earth . [I]0-i wake up in the morning , wanting to feel [your]628-you form next to [mine]0-i , but [you]628-you are gone . [[My]0-i father]1537-my father is very against [our]626-we marriage , as [you]628-you know . Chapter 9

Chapter 10

[She]503-gretchen padded across [the manor]158-the house on bare feet . [The house]158-the house was silent and dark , the sun not quite up yet . Hopefully that meant [Eldon]61-eldon was n’t up yet , either . A few minutes later , [she]503-gretchen opened the door to [[her]503-gretchen library]961-her library .

“ Oh , no . [The cat]29-hunter gave [her]29-hunter a disgruntled look and then [meowed]963-meowed again , flicking [his]1396-igor tail at [her]29-hunter and walking away .

[Gretchen]503-gretchen chuckled to [herself]29-hunter , then headed to [her]503-gretchen desk .

And stopped , [her]503-gretchen heart dropping .

“ No , no , no ! ”[503-gretchen] [She]503-gretchen rushed forward , yanking [her]503-gretchen laptop out of the puddle . Nothing .

Oh no .

[Her]503-gretchen flash drive ! [Gretchen]503-gretchen bolted to [her]503-gretchen feet and ran for the sopping desk . [Her]503-gretchen stomach twisted into a sick knot .

The entire file of transcribed letters , gone .

[Her]503-gretchen latest Astronaut Bill manuscript , completely gone .

Any chance of getting paid before [[her]503-gretchen landlord]789-her landlord changed the locks ? Gone .

[Gretchen]503-gretchen sank down on the couch , feeling wrecked . [She]503-gretchen stared at [her]503-gretchen poor laptop , at the flash drive in [her]503-gretchen hands .

* * *

Chapter 12

[She]503-gretchen ’d lied to [him]1396-igor the entire time .

[You]1132-you know [me]0-i . [I]0-i ’ll do anything for a paycheck .

“ Three million , ”[1139-him] [he]1139-him said quietly .

“ Good - bye , [Hunter]29-hunter . ”[503-gretchen]

[She]503-gretchen left [the room]205-the room , leaving [him]1139-him a little surprised and feeling a bit more alone than ever . [He]1139-him touched the scars on [his]1139-him face .

[Scarface]134-scarface . [Quasimodo]132-quasimodo .

Impossible .

* * *

The office phone rang .

Chapter 13

Even a week later , [Hunter]29-hunter still craved [her]26-audrey .

[He]29-hunter felt more alone than ever before .

Because [he]29-hunter ’d fucked it up . [He]29-hunter ’d had [a woman]277-a woman — [a smart , funny , beautiful woman who loved [him]29-hunter for [him]29-hunter and did n’t give a shit about [his]29-hunter hideous face]277-a woman — and [he]29-hunter ’d somehow driven [her]277-a woman away .

* * *

The next day , as [Gretchen]503-gretchen walked into [the coffee shop]1910-the cafe , [she]503-gretchen was met by a surprising scene .

Every table was covered in enormous vases full of roses . The interior of [the cafe]1910-the cafe looked more like a florist , and [customers]1214-customers were milling around , sniffing the flowers and exclaiming in wonder as [they]1214-customers held [their]1214-customers lattes .

Every rose was exactly the same color — that icy pale blue - purple that [she]503-gretchen ’d come to associate with [Blue Girl]80-blue girl . It was the rose [she]503-gretchen ’d told [Hunter]29-hunter that [she]503-gretchen liked the best .

[Gretchen]503-gretchen unwound [her]503-gretchen scarf from [her]503-gretchen neck , feeling warmth throughout [her]503-gretchen bones . [She]503-gretchen headed to the counter , unable to stop grinning . [She]503-gretchen knew who those were from and what [they]1213-they meant .

And while [she]503-gretchen could n’t be bought , well , it was a start .

[My]0-i lovely Lulabelle ,

[I]0-i never thought a day could seem longer than twenty - four hours . Once , [I]0-i cursed that the days were so short , for [they]1230-they seemed to rush past . [I]0-i have found a way , though , to make the day seem interminably long , for the hours to slow to molasses and minutes to crawl past as if unmoving .

[I]0-i simply need to be parted from [you]1231-my darling .

[I]0-i miss [you]1231-my darling , [[my]0-i darling]1231-my darling . [I]0-i miss [you]1231-my darling so very much that [my]0-i heart aches in [my]0-i breast . And so [I]0-i sit , watching the minutes descend into hours , and count the days until [you]1231-my darling return to [my]0-i arms . [I]0-i live for the day that [I]0-i can see [your]1231-my darling brilliant smile again , touch [your]1231-my darling lips to [mine]0-i , and know that [we]1232-we will never be parted again . All [my]0-i love ,

[Benedict
